flawed_nl_solution:
Jose has half as many bottles of domestic wine as imported wine, or 2400/2=<<2400/2=1200.0>>1200.0 bottles of domestic wine.
In total, he has 2400+1200.0=<<2400+1200.0=6300.0>>6300.0 bottles of wine.
If the guests drink one-third of all his wine, then they will have consumed 6300.0/3=<<6300.0/3=2100.0>>2100.0 bottles of wine.
Thus, after the party, Jose's private cellar will have 6300.0-2100.0=<<6300.0-2100.0=4200.0>>4200.0 remaining bottles of wine.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 3600.0, not 6300.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
